comment.author: 84619552@N00
comment._content:
This was where my father would solder the parts to his pewter ware together. He used an open flame gas torch for soldering. My mother stopped wearing full skirts because she once walked into the torch when he had it propped over his knee. Just a small burn hole but a good scare.

 I have that watch he's wearing.

comment.author: 16885779@N07
comment._content:
This is a great shot of our Skipper doing his day job!  His spare time was spent herding you men in to scouts. He was the leader of he S E S Salvages for many years.
.
Taught many of us how to be men!
